text:
Does anyone have experience with having their Twitter account hacked? I have a verified account that they made me jump through all kinds of hoops to get a few years ago. I had two factor authentication set up until I switched to a Republic Wireless phone. Since their numbers are considered VOIP, Twitter wouldn't let me keep that number as a verification tool. So I was without 2-factor awaiting a new phone solution  when someone logged in and changed my email and then my password. 

I'm freaking out and have a case opened with Twitter, but without access to the email or phone now associated with it (the hacker changed it), I'm not hopeful they can get it back. I would think with all I did to get the blue checkmark (show my ID and fill out multiple forms) to verify my ID, they would just let anyone else have it. I'm sick over this. Ideas? I have my Twitter feed connected to my Google knowledge panel for my books, so anything tweeted from there shows up on the home page for my name. I think I can disconnect from my knowledge panel in the meantime?

elements.text:
Does anyone have experience with having their Twitter account hacked? I have a verified account that they made me jump through all kinds of hoops to get a few years ago. I had two factor authentication set up until I switched to a Republic Wireless phone. Since their numbers are considered VOIP, Twitter wouldn't let me keep that number as a verification tool. So I was without 2-factor awaiting a new phone solution  when someone logged in and changed my email and then my password. 

I'm freaking out and have a case opened with Twitter, but without access to the email or phone now associated with it (the hacker changed it), I'm not hopeful they can get it back. I would think with all I did to get the blue checkmark (show my ID and fill out multiple forms) to verify my ID, they would just let anyone else have it. I'm sick over this. Ideas? I have my Twitter feed connected to my Google knowledge panel for my books, so anything tweeted from there shows up on the home page for my name. I think I can disconnect from my knowledge panel in the meantime?

text: Update: Twitter got my account back! I will likely lose verified status if I can't provide a compatible SMS number. Looking into phone options now. Something to think about. I really loved Republic Wireless but this is a no go.

elements.text: Update: Twitter got my account back! I will likely lose verified status if I can't provide a compatible SMS number. Looking into phone options now. Something to think about. I really loved Republic Wireless but this is a no go.

text: Hi folks! I've been writing for legal professionals for quite some time now. I've recently started writing for legal SaaS companies. But I'm looking to write for the SaaS space in different niches like productivity, and marketing. I've written scripts for a personal growth podcast previously but I don't have samples in SaaS and can't find folks who accept newbies. I'm also looking to get into sales and web copy and I do have experience writing law firm web copy but again, I want to get into other niches to write copy.  What do you think is the best approach to do this? Are there any resources I can use?
